node.text: Oh, um... greetings traveling soul. You don't look like the average peasant. I pray, might you be the Dreamguard Champion I called for?

option.optiontext: Dreamguard Champion? I don't think so...

node.text: I see, my apologies. Several nights back I sent word to the High Visioners of our monastic order requesting aid from the Dreamguard. Champion Jorune Drey, said to be in the region, answered the call.
But weeks have passed and he's been neither seen nor heard from. My predicament remains unresolved and I don't know what to do.

option.optiontext: What predicament, exactly?
I'm sorry to hear that. Good luck.

node.text: It's the Tomb of the Elder Druid - it's become haunted. Disturbed by the magics of Hydrobor, I believe, the skeleton of the Elder Druid Stratificas himself awoke in fury. How could I possibly appease the tomb without the Dreamguard to aid me?

option.optiontext: You don't need them. I can take care of this for you.
Why are these Dreamguard important?
Elder Druid Stratificas?
Difficult indeed. Good luck.

node.text: You could? I would be ever so grateful, but adventurer, I must warn you; although the Elder Druid's remains represent a mere echo of his power in life, confronting him is still a perilous task indeed!

option.optiontext: The fear of death no longer quite disturbs me the same as it once did - I trust I'll be fine.
Then I would appreciate any advice you could offer.

node.text: Hmm, yes... The master priest himself resides by the old shrine outside the city to the north. I recall he keeps incantations against the undead by the altar there; they might be of use to you if you can learn them.

option.optiontext: Very well, I trust I can return the Elder Druid to rest.

node.text: Why, they are the esteemed warrior monks of our order, specialized in the ways of calming and vanquishing raging undead. In these turbulent times, their services are sadly often needed.

option.optiontext: The Dreamguard you mentioned - Jorune - why would he not show up?
Who's Elder Druid Stratificas?
You don't need them. I can take care of this for you.
A difficult situation indeed. Good luck.

node.text: Oh, Stratificas was a renowned Elder Druid of the Ebon Green Circle many centuries ago, whose connection with the nature and healing magics is told to be the stuff of legends. He still holds a special place in the local memory and many would visit his grave, if it was not... well, you understand.

option.optiontext: Why are these Dreamguard important?
I can take care of this for you.
A difficult situation indeed. Good luck.

node.text: That is most troubling indeed. The Dreamguard do not shy away from their duties; it's possible he's been drastically delayed, but I do fear the worst might have happened. Confronting undead monsters is a necessary task, but also one that is most hazardous.

I only know he was investigating the ruins of Greywall southeast before contact with him was lost. If your travels take you in that direction, perhaps you might discover his fate. I shiver to think, the Greywall dungeons have a dark reputation...

option.optiontext: Back to the issue at hand, who's Elder Druid Stratificas?
Perhaps in his absence I can take care of this undead problem.
Indeed, good luck.

node.text: When you're ready, you'll find Stratificas down in his tomb by the corner of our cemetery. I may not be of much help in cleansing the tomb, but I'll do my best to provide answers to any questions you have.

option.optiontext: I put down the undead druid. What do you make of these writings I found on him?
Wait, I found something but I don't have it on me...
Tell me about the Elder Druid.
Tell me about the Dreamguard.

node.text: Hmm, let's see. \n\n <color=cyan> *The priest initiate studies the writings you brought intently.* </color>
Hmm... Hmmm... Hmm, yes... I see... Hmmmmm...

Yes, these are written in an old druidic cipher, unintelligible to the common folk but familiar to any who studied the old cultures of Imberthale, including myself. There is a spell detailed within, which I could transcribe to you, if you're interested...?

option.optiontext: Yes, please! One can never know too many spells.
Is there anything else?

node.text: Indeed, just a moment... \n\n <color=cyan> *The priest initiate swiftly transcribes the spell into a book for you.* </color>

Here you go, champion. Sadly there isn't much else I can reward your altruistic efforts with, but I hope this druidic secret can serve as a form of compensation. Ahem... 'May the wisdom of our ancestors light your path, traveler.'

option.optiontext: As yours, initiate.

node.text: Oh, yes! There is plenty of interesting philosophy here, much that will intrigue historians, thinkers and students I believe. It also supports my suspicions about druidic beliefs being at odds with Hydrobor magics. I assure you, this is a most valuable find and...

option.optiontext: In that case I'll just take the spell, please.

Any word from your missing Dreamguard champion?
What do you know about Elder Druid Stratificas?
Happy to help.

node.text: Everything is well, thank you.
